Recap: Everyone is gathered at Towers for Lizzie and Coop's wedding. Frank and Olivia debate whether or not the wedding will take place. Marina arrives and flirts with Alan Michael but later admits to Frank that she's playing him for information for Harley. Coop remembers his time with Ava but then tells Lizzie that he's put his feelings for Ava behind him and that after their wedding he'll be focused on her and the baby. Jonathan and Tammy celebrate their leaving Springfield by making love. They are later interrupted by a phone call from Collin who is caring for Reva at Cedars. Reva has the flu and with her immune system compromised by chemo, it could be devastating. Jonathan makes an excuse to go see Reva without Tammy. At first Jonathan believes that Reva is fine when he hears she has the flu, but once he sees her he knows how serious things are. Jonathan asks Reva what he can do to help, and she says acknowledge his daughter. Jonathan goes off to do so, but tells Billy of Reva's condition. Reva and Billy share a tender moment when he tells her he knows about her cancer. Tammy finds Ava in Company's freezer and takes her to the wedding. Jonathan stops the wedding and tells Coop that he and not Coop, fathered Lizzie's baby. Tammy hears the admission.
Transcript: Rutledge: What a beautiful day for your granddaughter's wedding, Mr. Spaulding. You must be a very happy man.
Alan: Couldn't be happier.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Frank: The Spaulding's certainly pulled this together in a hurry, didn't they?
Olivia: Yeah, but this is very low-key for them.
Frank: I guess you would know.
Olivia: Don't start.
Frank: ( Laughs ) Seriously, I mean, if Lizzie were marrying someone other than a Cooper, I'm sure Alan would have rented out the Taj Mahal.
Olivia: I'm just trying to figure out, is this a happy occasion?
Frank: I know some people aren't thrilled, but I'm really proud of Coop for standing up for his kid. I mean, what is more important than family, right?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: Here, it will calm your nerves.
Marina: Nervous, who says I'm nervous? I'm not nervous.
Alan-Michael: I am, so I thought you might be.
Marina: You're nervous about Coop and Lizzie getting married?
Alan Michael: No, that is what it is. I was nervous about seeing you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alexandra: Well, well, well. Here he is, father of the groom.
Buzz: Cool as can be.
Alexandra: It looks lovely, doesn't it?
Buzz: Well, you guys throw great parties.
Alexandra: But you don't seem in the mood to celebrate?
Buzz: You are?
Alexandra: I am cautiously optimistic.
Buzz: Good for you. Where's the bride?
Alexandra: Well Lillian and Beth are helping Lizzie get dressed. So, where's the groom?
Buzz: Good question. He disappeared while I was dressing. I haven't seen him since.
Alexandra: Oh...
Buzz: Oh, not to worry. He's not me. He'll be here.
Alexandra: ( Laughs )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: It's for our baby, Coop. I'm pregnant. ( Echoing )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: We're really leaving town!
Jonathan: You and me, enough of this town.
Tammy: Who needs that stupid wedding, anyway?
Jonathan: ( Laughs ) Yeah, well, let's stop worrying about everything except us because when we get on that road, by tonight we are going to be far away from here.
Tammy: Hmm, works for me. Pit stop before we go. I mean, what do we have to stay in Springfield for anyway? For my mom and your mom-- it's not like they're babies, they don't need us.

Lizzie: In a couple of hours, it is going to be me, Coop, and the baby, for better or worse, till death do us part, okay. We are going to be a family, unless you do something to screw that up. So this is it, Jonathan. Promise me that you are going to walk away from this baby for good.
Tammy: Hey, what are you thinking?
Jonathan: I'm thinking you're right. I'm thinking that there is no reason for us to stay here.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Colin: Lie back. Keep her on nasal O2 at three liters and get an ABG. And keep an eye on her stats.
Reva: It's just the flu.
Colin: Please, Reva, be quiet. And call respiratory and get a nebulizer. And I want another chest x-ray on her.
Reva: You know what? My first round of series chemo was a breeze compared to this.
Colin: That's what I'm trying to tell you. The chemo has suppressed your immune system. That's why we're trying to get these antibiotics in you as fast as possible.
Reva: Or what?
Colin: Or things could rapidly progress in direction that we don't want them to.
Reva: What does that mean? Are you saying I could die?
Colin: I'm saying this is very serious, Reva. Please, lie back.
Reva: I can't believe this is happening. I mean, I was coughing just a minute ago and now... (gasps )
Nurse: Hold my hand and breathe.
Colin: Upper fluids.
Nurse: Deep even breaths.
Reva: I'm freezing. I'm freezing. But I'm sweating. What is happening to me?
Colin: Reva, listen to me, okay. You need to call someone and let them know you're here.
Reva: You, you're here.
Colin: No, a family member. Your husband.
Reva: No!
Colin: Yes, Reva, you have to let me call someone. You shouldn't be alone right now.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: There is nothing holding us here, so the sooner we get out, the better.
Tammy: Whoa! ( Laughter )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Beth: Oh, sweetie, you look so beautiful. I know I keep saying it, but...
Lizzie: Okay, let me guess: I'm glowing. How does my belly look?
Beth: You're belly looks perfect.
Lillian: Beth, I need some more bobby pins. Get me some, honey.
Beth: Yeah. I don't see any.
Lillian: Oh, there have to be.
Lizzie: I think we might be out of them.
Lillian: Out of bobby pins? I'm not even done. I want to make your beautiful hair perfect today, so I'm going to go get some, honey.
Lizzie: Okay. Nana?
Lillian: Yeah?
Lizzie: I know that you have doubts about this, but you'll see. Coop is going to be a wonderful husband and a wonderful father, and we're going to be really, really happy.
Lillian: That's really what I want for you, sweetheart.
Beth: Don't worry, she'll come around.
Lizzie: I just want nana and granddad to just be excited for me. I don't want anything to ruin this day.
Beth: Nothing will. All of your friends and family are going to be around you to help you celebrate. And Jonathan and Tammy won't be here, and neither will Ava.
Lizzie: What if Ava shows up?

Beth: She won't. She won't. I took care of everything. Oh, sweetie, you're going to have the happiness that seems to have alluded being a Raines woman. You're going to have it. Well, we need to get you dressed. ( Knock on the door ) Oh, that was fast. Mom, it's open!
Coop: Beth. Will you excuse us? We need to talk.
Beth: Coop, you know that the groom is not supposed to see the bride before the wedding.
Coop: Beth, I don't believe in superstitions. It's important, please.
Lizzie: It's okay, Mom.
Beth: Okay.
Lizzie: What is it? Is it my grandfather?
Coop: Well, he certainly is trying very hard to turn me into a Spaulding. That's not going to happen.
Lizzie: Of course not. Don't worry, Henry, I have no desire to change you. I love you just the way you are. Maybe they'll play that at our reception.
Coop: Maybe. Look, um, there's something else that I have to tell you. It's the real reason why I'm here.
Lizzie: Okay.
Coop: Lizzie, this is something that we need to be clear on, all right?
Lizzie: Okay.
Coop: Lizzie, um, I know it seemed for the last little bit while that things have been kind of complicated. My feelings have seemed probably divided.
Lizzie: Coop...

Coop: Look, I'm just saying that after today, you're not going to have to worry about doubting me again. Okay? You and I are going to be husband and wife. We're going to be married. And we're also going to be parents.
Lizzie: ( Laughs )
Coop: But from now on, that's all I'm going to think about, and that's all I'm going to care about, okay?
Lizzie: I love you so much.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan: What is the hold up now? Well, keep me posted.
Buzz: Got everything under control?
Alan: You tell me, Buzz. Your son just barged in and demanded an audience with Elizabeth, and he kicked Beth out and now he and Elizabeth are talking.
Buzz: Interesting.
Alan: Interesting? Oh, come on, Buzz, don't be so annoying.
Buzz: Sorry.
Alan: Another Cooper- Spaulding union. God help us, Buzz.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: Please, don't tell me that you were so anxious about seeing me that you had to toss back a couple. Please, Alan-Michael, that is such a line.
Alan-Michael: Not a bad one, though.
Marina: I noticed you didn't bring me here as your date.
Alan-Michael: You would have said yes?
Marina: It might have been fun to turn you down.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Frank: I can't believe she can't find a nice, decent, normal guy.
Buzz: Well, at least they're not walking down the aisle.
Frank: You got that right. Where you going?
Buzz: I've got things to do.
Frank: You need backup?
Buzz: No, I got this one.
Olivia: Are you and your dad okay?
Frank: Um, I just think he's got something else on his mind right now.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: You're not going to tell Josh. You're not going to tell anyone.
Colin: Reva, lie back, please.
Reva: No.
Colin: Be reasonable, okay? You said that you would keep this quiet until you couldn't anymore. Well, listen, you can't anymore, okay?
Reva: If you take one step towards a phone, and I will run out of here. I mean it, I will.

Colin: How are you going to leave, Reva, crawl? Look, I know how hard you have worked to keep your cancer from Josh, and I think you're crazy, but strange as it is, I sort of admire you, all that you've done. But now--
Reva: You're not going to change my mind.

Colin: Reva, I don't mean to scare you, but if these antibiotics don't help you, things could get worse for you very quickly. And if that should happen, I guarantee you, you will want your husband here.
Reva: No. If you're half the doctor you keep bragging you are, you'll honor my wishes and not call my husband.
Colin: Try to get some rest. I'll be back.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: You know, we could have been on the road by now if you didn't distract me.
Tammy: Me distract you?
Jonathan: Yeah. You want to distract me some more?
Tammy: At this rate, we'll never get out of town.
Jonathan: Okay, okay. I'll be good. I'll be a good boy. Um, I don't know. Maybe we could pull over on the side of the road and then--
Tammy: I think we should probably hold out until we get where we're going. Where are we going?
Jonathan: Who knows? I just figure we'll let the road take us where it takes us. Remember, Tammy, it's not the destination that is important. It's about what you've learned along the way.
Tammy: Listen to you. ( Laughs ) You sound like someone's dad. So, ready to go?
Jonathan: Yeah, let's go. Let's get out of here. ( Telephone ringing ) Yeah.
Colin: Mr. Randall, this is Dr. McCabe at Cedars.
Jonathan: You're Reva's guy, right?
Colin: Yes, her Oncologist. Could you come down to the hospital? I need to speak to you about something.
Jonathan: Actually, I was just on my way out of town.
Colin: Well, it's important, actually, it's very important. If you could just come down to the hospital, I can't explain it on the phone.
Jonathan: Okay. Yeah, I'll be there in a minute.
Tammy: What was that all about?
Jonathan: What else? Reva.
Tammy: Who's her guy?
Jonathan: Her assistant is making up some kind of emergency. Basically just because she wants to talk to me, so... sorry, but the sooner I handle this, the sooner we can hit the road.
Tammy: It's okay. I have things I can do before we go. Don't take too long. The sooner we get out of here, the sooner we can distract each other again.
Jonathan: I'll hurry.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: There is a weird energy in here. Do you think they're actually going to go through with it?
Frank: I don't know. Dad went off to talk to Coop, and I have no idea what that means. So uh-- no thank you.
Olivia: Thanks. Is Coop getting cold feet?
Frank: Oh, no way. Coop's pretty committed, that's for sure.
Olivia: Yeah, but does he love her? Or does he love somebody else?
Frank: I know Ava cares a lot about him. And I'm glad she's not here because seeing this would certainly break her heart.
Olivia: That's so nice that you're concerned about her.

Frank: We talked a little. I mean, I feel bad for her, you know. She's still new in town; she doesn't have any family and that whole mess with Sandy Foster, and now this. She's a great girl. I just feel bad for her, that's all.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Coop, you have my promise that I am going to be a wonderful wife to you. Sit. And a wonderful mother to this child, our child. I know that if it wasn't for her, you wouldn't be here.
Coop: Lizzie...

Lizzie: No, just let me finish. I know that you had feelings for Ava, and I know part of you is wondering what might have been. But I honestly believe that everything happens for a reason. And I'm having this baby because somebody up there, they think that we deserve a second chance. And I know that you were in love with me once, and I believe that, in my heart, you will be again. We are going to have an amazing life.
Coop: Hmm, well-- but, but, but...
Lizzie: But?
Coop: You... get over here. Come here. ( Laughter ) All right, you need to finish getting ready.
Lizzie: I do, and I'm glad that you didn't see me in my dress, because the bad luck only counts if I'm in the dress.
Coop: Uh-huh.
Lizzie: Come here.
Coop: What?
Lizzie: This is going to be a great day. ( Laughs )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lillian: Beth, is something wrong?
Beth: Oh, Coop came by to talk to Lizzie. He's in there with her now.
Lillian: Oh. Well, I guess whatever will be, will be.
Beth: Thanks.
Lillian: Beth, it's hard enough to make a marriage work when two people are passionately in love. Look at you and Phillip.
Beth: Yes, look at Phillip and me. Maybe it's better to go into a relationship with lower expectations.
Lillian: Keep thinking that.
Beth: I just want to support Lizzie. After everything she's been through, I just want her to have a happy life.
Lillian: So do I, sweetheart.
Buzz: Oh, hello.
Lillian: Hi, Buzz.
Buzz: Are both the bride and the groom in there?
Beth: Yes, yes, do you have any idea what Coop would be talking about?
Buzz: I haven't a clue.
Beth: Well, he wouldn't call things off now, would he?
Buzz: I-- ( stammering ) I don't think so, but you know, you never know.
Coop: Hello.
Buzz: Is everything all right?
Coop: Yeah, everything is fine.
Lizzie: It's better than fine. It's wonderful. It's almost time!
Beth: Well, then, I guess we'd better get you dressed. ( Laughs ) Yes.
Lillian: Thank you.
Buzz: Uh-huh. So, everything is still on schedule?
Coop: Yeah, yeah, everything is on schedule. So...
Buzz: So?
Coop: Come on.
Buzz: Okay.
Coop: Okay. ( Laughs )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Hey.
Colin: Mr. Randall, thanks for coming so quickly. Your mother had you down on her emergency form.
Jonathan: Why didn't Reva call me herself?
Colin: Well, your mother who's a very bad case of influenza.
Jonathan: The flu, that's why you called me down here?
Colin: No, no, no.
Jonathan: You know I had a whole trip planned. I have somewhere to be.
Colin: Well you said that on the phone.
Jonathan: Where's Reva? Is she in there?
Colin: Yes, she is, but--
Jonathan: Okay, the flu. You know what? I'll stop in and say hi, but then I really got to get going.
Colin: Before you go-- ( sighs )
Jonathan: What is this?
Colin: The course of chemotherapy has suppressed her immune system. In that weakened state, even the slightest infection can wreak havoc.
Jonathan: Hey. Reva, can you hear me, Mom? Hey.
Reva: When did you get here?
Jonathan: Just now. When did this happen? The last time I saw you, you seemed fine. What's going on? What do you need? What can I do for you?
Reva: I've already told you, what I've been telling you for weeks. Please, Jonathan, please, you have to acknowledge that you're the father of Lizzie's baby.
[SCENE_BREAK]

John Driscoll, "Inside The Light." Ava is genuine. Lizzie is-- Lizzie is unique. Buzz is good hearted. Harley's strong. I hang out a lot with Michelle and I hang out a lot with Marcy, and I hang out with Frank. You know, it's always an adventure hanging out with Frank. I love him to death, don't get me wrong. See Coop Wednesday, June 21, "Inside The Light."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Reva, I didn't come here to talk about Lizzie and the baby. I'm serious, what can I do for you?
Reva: I told you.
Jonathan: One problem at a time. You first.
Reva: When's the wedding?
Jonathan: Who cares?
Reva: Jonathan, please tell me when it is?
Jonathan: It's happening, okay? Lizzie's going to marry Coop. It's going to be the best thing for everyone.
Reva: That baby is yours. That baby is yours. You hated me when I walked away from you. And now you're doing the exact same thing. You know you're making a mistake. I can see it in your eyes.
Colin: Jonathan, can I see you for a moment?
Reva: We're not finished yet.
Jonathan: We'll be right back, okay?
Reva: ( Coughing )
Colin: Please don't get her agitated. You can see in her weakened state...
Jonathan: I wasn't getting her agitated. She's agitating herself. So what's going on? You'll give her drugs to make her feel better, right? When's that going to start working?
Colin: I can't say.
Jonathan: You can't say. How long is she going to be in here?
Colin: I can't tell you that either. Her condition is serious, Jonathan.
Jonathan: I get that. How serious?
Colin: Very serious.
Jonathan: It's going to be get better, right?
Colin: We'll certainly do everything we can for her.
Jonathan: This is nuts. I can't believe this is happening. Reva could die? Before she gets to see the baby.
Colin: Jonathan, what I need to know for you is: Will you be here for her? You're the only person who knows she's ill. She shouldn't be by herself right now. Jonathan?
Jonathan: What? Yeah, yeah, I'll be here. I just, um... have to take care of something first. You can stay with her until I get back.
Colin: No, actually, I--
Jonathan: Just stay with her.
Reva: Where's my son?
Colin: He'll be back soon.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Billy: Howdy, stranger.
Jonathan: Hey.
Billy: What brings you here?
Jonathan: I was just visiting someone.
Billy: Oh, yeah.
Jonathan: What about you?
Billy: Oh, I was at an A.A. meeting. You know, I have to make one a day, or Reva starts to give me a little grief. Well, I'll see you around.
Jonathan: Billy, wait up a sec. I've got to tell you something.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: I guess it's closed for the wedding. Oh, that's weird. Hello? Hello, the front door was open? Hello?
Ava: Help! Get me out of here. Help me! Anybody!
Tammy: Oh, my gosh.
Ava: Tammy!
Tammy: Ava.
Ava: Oh!
Tammy: Here. Ava, how in the world did you lock yourself in the freezer?
Ava: I didn't, I didn't. Someone shoved me in there and locked the door.
Tammy: Who?
Ava: Lizzie's mommy's chauffeur, following her orders.
Tammy: You're kidding me?

Ava: No. They showed up here when I was closing up, and the next thing you know, I'm a popsicle. Lizzie, I think Beth thought I was going to show up at the wedding and I don't raise hell or something. Oh, my God. After little Lizzie shows up here, shoving my nose in her happiness, acting like she won and I lost. I mean, it's like... it's unbelievable. I don't know. I mean I know you're friends with her, but this is just like--
Tammy: Sometimes.
Ava: She acts like-- oh, my God-- like Coop is some sort of prize. You know, like she won him. You know what, he is a prize, Tammy, but not like that. He's a prize because of who he is.
Tammy: I cannot believe they locked you in there. You've got to something about it.
Ava: What am I going to do? It's my word against Beth's word. She's going to win. There is nothing I can do.
Tammy: Oh, yes, there is. Come on.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: Hey, there he is.
Coop: Hi, Olivia. Frank, why you looking at me like that?
Frank: Oh, no reason. You okay?
Coop: Yeah, I'm great. Never better. If you guys can excuse me, I need to talk to the Reverend for just a second, okay?
Frank: Sure.
Buzz: Everything is fine, I guess.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: Well, it looks like things are getting under way.
Alan-Michael: Marina, you look beautiful. Didn't I tell you that?
Marina: No.
Alan-Michael: Well, you do.
Marina: Well, you don't look so bad yourself.
Alexandra: Just a little F.Y.I., darling, your father's watching who you're talking to-- everyone you're talking to.
Alan-Michael: Do me a favor, Aunt Alex, ask dad if it will bother him if I start dating Marina again, and if the answer is yes, tell him I'll be sure to do it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: So, are we good to go?
Frank: Yeah, pretty soon. We're just waiting on the bride.
Marina: Good.
Frank: I happened to notice that you were talking to Alan-Michael.
Marina: It's nothing, Dad, don't worry about it.
Frank: Honey, what's going on?
Marina: Can you keep a secret?
Frank: Sure.
Marina: Well, I'm just trying to keep an eye on him. I'm trying to get to the bottom of whatever it is that he's doing to Harley. And I figured it would be nice if I played nice with him.
Frank: I don't like it.
Marina: Well, it's not real, Dad. Do you honestly think that I could be interested in him after everything he's done to our family? It'd be nuts!
Olivia: Here you go.
Frank: Oh, thank you.
Olivia: Hold that for me.
Frank: Sure.
Olivia: Here.
Frank: What?
Olivia: Fix that.
Frank: Oh. Thanks.
Olivia: You're very handsome.
Marina: So, are you nervous, Henry?
Coop: No, not really.
Frank: Well, then you're a better man than I am.
Buzz: Better than all of us.
Coop: Hey, guys, please, come on. This is a wedding, not a funeral. Can we lighten it up a little bit here? ( Cell phone rings )
Frank: Oh, excuse me, I just got a call.
Marina: Are you happy?
Coop: I am. It's my wedding day.
Frank: I'll be right there. You know what, excuse me. I've got a little police situation here. So hopefully it won't take very long. Are you going to be okay?
Marina: Of course she'll be okay. She can hang out with me.
Frank: Ah, good girl. And you know what? Hopefully, I'll be back in time to watch you catch the bouquet.
Olivia: Oh, you know, I'm going to leave that honor to Marina. And I'm actually going with you because I'm going to drag you back to the reception later after your business. Bye.
Frank: Coop, I'll be back.
Marina: Great, they're dropping like flies. I love this wedding! Well, they seem happy together. They seem like they're getting close. That's good, I like her.
Buzz: Me, too.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan: Beth, where is Elizabeth?
Beth: Well...
Alan: Oh, Elizabeth.
Lizzie: Hi, Granddad.
Alan: You look absolutely beautiful, sweetheart.
Beth: No, no, no, you'll mess her makeup. ( Laughter )
Lizzie: So, Granddad, are you ready to give me away?
Alan: Never, but if this is what you want...
Lizzie: This is what I've always wanted, Granddad: Coop and me together forever. Everything that I had to do to get here was worth it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
( Coughing )
Billy: Hey, darlin'.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rutledge: I have just been informed that the bride is ready, are you?
Coop: You ready, Pop?
Buzz: As I'll ever be. ( Music playing )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: I'll be right back.
Alexandra: ( Gasps )
Alan-Michael: I've got to take care of something. ( Music playing )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan: Elizabeth, that's our cue. Are you ready?
Lizzie: Ready? I want to run down that aisle. ( Laughs ) ( "Wedding March" playing )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Beth: I'll be right back.
Lillian: You can't go now...
Beth: Good-bye, Jonathan.
Jonathan: Get out of my way.
Beth: You listen to me. You made a promise to Lizzie and you will keep it.
Chauffeur: Need some help, Mrs. Spaulding?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan: Where's Beth?

Rutledge: Please be seated. Dearly beloved, we are here today to witness and bless the joining together of this man and this woman in the bonds of holy matrimony. The union of husband and wife in hearts, minds, and body is intended by God for their mutual joy.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Chauffeur: You don't have an invitation, sir.
Jonathan: I don't need one.
Beth: Kindly escort Mr. Randall out.
Rutledge: Speak now or forever hold their piece. ( Table crashes ) ( guests react )
Lizzie: Jonathan! Granddad, get him out of here!
Beth: Jonathan.
Coop: Look, Jonathan, I don't know what the hell this is about--
Jonathan: Shut up. Everyone, shut up! Shut up! I have to say something!
Lizzie: No!
Tammy: Jonathan? What are you doing?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Billy: So, how you doing? Don't tell me fine, because, frankly, you don't look good.
Reva: How did you--
Billy: I was here for a meeting and I ran into Jonathan and he told me.
Reva: Yeah, the flu, can you believe it? I mean, it's a really, really tough strain this year.
Billy: Reva, he told me you have breast cancer. Now, I want you to tell me what I can do to help you, okay?
Reva: ( Sobbing )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: Jonathan?
Coop: Jonathan, you don't belong here.
Tammy: What are you doing?
Lizzie: There is a wedding going on here, in case you hadn't noticed! Please go. Go with Tammy! Get on with your life, and let Coop and me and our baby get on with ours! Did you hear me?
Tammy: Jonathan.
Jonathan: Tammy, I'm so sorry.
Tammy: Sorry about what?
Lizzie: No, Jonathan, don't do it. Don't do it. You're going to regret this for the rest of your life!
Jonathan: No, if I don't do it, then I'll regret it.
Lizzie: No!
Jonathan: Coop, Lizzie's been lying to you. That baby is not yours; it's mine. I'm the father of that kid. ( Guests react )
[NEXT_ON]
Billy: You can't do this without him. You can't go through this alone. You can't do it without him.
Reva: Watch me.
Lizzie: All I want to do is marry Coop and get on with my life!
Jonathan: Good, marry Coop! I don't care, as long as he knows the kid is mine!
Buzz: You knew that Jonathan was the father of the baby?!
Jonathan: That baby is mine. I have no choice, I can't walk away, not anymore.
Coop: Jonathan is the baby's father. Me, I'm just the idiot that believed all of your lies.
Transcript Author: Provided by Suzanne Proofread By Tanya
